intro: Cryptopus elatus, commonly known as the silverleaf cryptopus, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its dense, silver-gray foliage. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated in gardens and as a houseplant.
